unit_learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate an awareness of applied ethical and cultural conduct in all aspects of professional activities.
Develop key workplace skills that will help maximise your contribution to your field of work and build a positive workplace experience.
Set long-term career goals and identify strategies to achieve these goals.
Investigate and compare the diverse career options where an understanding of cognitive science is essential, valuable, or advantageous.
Consolidate practical transition skills including effective communication and critical thinking skills.
Critically reflect on core knowledge and key skills gained throughout your program of study for the purpose of appreciating the value of these skills in your future profession.

enrolment_rules.description: 130cp including COGS2000 or COGS202 or COGS2010 or COGS2020 or COGS2030 or COGS2040 or COGS2050

assessments.description: Group multimedia presentation that translates recent cognitive science research into a multimedia experience for a lay audience (10%, 3-5 minute presentation). This group presentation is accompanied by an individual science communication blog post (15%, max. 750 words).
Multimedia summary of the placement including one example of reflection implemented during the placement (max. 4 minutes).

The portfolio consists of 3 components: A cover letter responding to specific selection criteria (15%, max. 1000 words, graded); an aspirational CV (5%, max. 4 pages, pass/fail); peer review of aspirational portfolios (5%, pass/fail).
Weekly online quizzes embedded within online lectures.

data.description: This PACE unit enables students to prepare themselves for the next phase of their career in research, industry, or beyond. The lecture series covers a set of tools that students will be equipped with to apply cognitive science in the real world. Throughout this unit, strong focus will be placed on ethical and cultural competence; effective scientific communication; the consolidation of acquired knowledge and practical skills; and deepening one's understanding of cognitive science, especially the connections between the various disciplines of cognitive science and their impact on modern society. This will be complemented by a video series in which guest speakers will describe the role of cognitive science in their career.
